snippet: The secretary of health and human services, Kathleen Sebelius, is urged to find out whether the program violated federal employee protections and whistle-blower laws.
abstract: Rep Chris Van Hollen, Democrat of Maryland, sends letter to Kathleen Sebelius, the secretary of health and human services, urging her to investigate whether a wide-ranging surveillance program that the Food and Drug Administration mounted against a group of its scientists had violated federal employee protections and whistle-blower laws; the scientists who were being investigated had raised warnings about the safety of medical imaging devices.
lead_paragraph: The secretary of health and human services, Kathleen Sebelius, is urged to find out whether the program violated federal employee protections and whistle-blower laws.

headline.seo: Inquiry Sought of Extensive F.D.A. Surveillance
